titleInfo.title: These men guard pharmacy laws of state, from the Nashville Times, 1940

location.physicalLocation: Metropolitan Nashville/Davidson County Archives, Nashville Public Library

mods.abstract: A captioned photo from the Nashville Times (1940), about the Pharmacy business. The caption reads: “When your prescription is sent to the drugstore it’s a pretty safe bet that the man who fills it knows his business because he’s had to take a pretty stiff examination supervised by the above members of the Tennessee Board of Pharmacy. Above, left to right, are: Allen F. Tay.lor, president, Elizabeth; Phil Vance, vice-president, Chattanooga; Robert Walker, secretary, Nashville; Tom Turner, past president, Henning; and Eugene W. Wright, past president, Memphis. The Board is meeting here in connection with the state meeting of the Tennessee Pharmaceutics Association.” Forms part of the Nashville Times newspaper collection. 1 digital photo.
mods.accessCondition: U.S. and international copyright laws protect this digital content, which is provided for educational purposes only and may not be downloaded, reproduced, or distributed for any other purpose without written permission.
